intro: Senecio elatoides, commonly known as the desert lettuce, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in arid environments, making it well adapted to harsh conditions. Its small, edible leaves have been used in traditional cuisine, and it is also cultivated as an ornamental plant. Senecio elatoides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
